availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Nancy Dunning. Father of Jesse Dunning, Atha Dunning, Miles R. Dunning, Miranda Dunning, Matilda Dunning, Eliza Dunning, Huey Dunning, Freeman Dunning , Elizabeth Dunning, and Nancy Dunning. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Princeton and Pollards Tan Yard in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 351A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 155.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 44-45.
